com.github.dm.jrt.function

Class FunctionDecorator<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.DeepEqualObject
      • com.github.dm.jrt.function.FunctionDecorator<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input data type.
    OUT - the output data type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Decorator, Function<IN,OUT>

    public class FunctionDecorator<IN,OUT>
extends DeepEqualObject
implements Function<IN,OUT>, Decorator
    Class decorating a function instance.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 10/11/2015.

      • decorate

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> FunctionDecorator<IN,OUT> decorate(@NotNull
                                                                   Function<IN,OUT> function)
        Decorates the specified function instance so to provide additional features.
        The returned object will support concatenation and comparison.

        Note that the passed object is expected to have a functional behavior, that is, it must not retain a mutable internal state.
        Note also that any external object used inside the function must be synchronized in order to avoid concurrency issues.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        function - the function instance.
        Returns:
        the decorated function.

      • identity

        @NotNull
public static <IN> FunctionDecorator<IN,IN> identity()
        Returns the identity function decorator.
        The returned object will support concatenation and comparison.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Returns:
        the function decorator.

        @NotNull
public <AFTER> FunctionDecorator<IN,AFTER> andThen(@NotNull
                                                            Function<? super OUT,? extends AFTER> after)
        Returns a composed function decorator that first applies this function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result.
        Type Parameters:
        AFTER - the type of output of the after function.
        Parameters:
        after - the function to apply after this function is applied.
        Returns:
        the composed function.
